data.question: What is the name of the material that exhibits a shape-memory effect?
What are the three distinct phases of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
At what temperature does the transformation from X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α to X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β occur?
What triggers the shape-memory effect in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
Is the shape-memory phase of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i reversible, and if so, how can it be reverted?
data.answer: Yes, it is reversible and can be reverted by heating at >400 K under vacuum or by soaking in DMF.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-γ calculated from 77 K N2 sorption?
Does X-pcu-3-Zn-3i exhibit a stepped isotherm during CO2 adsorption at 195 K?
Can X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-g revert to X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α by soaking in methanol?
What method was used to study the in situ variable temperature PXRD?
data.answer: The method involved increasing the temperature to 10°C/10 min under N2 atmosphere and recording data.

data.question: What is the role of interpenetration in the structure of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
data.answer: Interpenetration enables framework-framework interactions to stabilize less dense variants.

data.question: Is the shape-memory effect in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i induced by multiple sorbates?
Does the shape-memory phase X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-g exhibit a type I isotherm in subsequent CO2 sorption cycles at 195 K?
What is the crystallographic space group of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α?
What is the density of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β?
Can X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-g retain its structure upon heating up to 240°C?
What is the guest accessible volume in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-g?
Is the transformation from X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α to X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β reversible?
What is the method used for synthesizing the ligand L1?
data.answer: The method developed by A. Bajpai was used.

data.question: What is the significance of the interpenetrated structure in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
data.answer: The interpenetrated structure facilitates sliding of networks for structural transformation.

data.question: Does the shape-memory effect in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i depend on the particle size?
